# Salvage
[color=#999999][italic]"Ooh! Some loo- oh."[/italic][/color]
[color=cyan]Salvage[/color] one of the stations sources of income, and the main alternative for Lavaland. Salvage extracts money from the [color=cyan]Space Debris[/color] that orbit the station.
While the void of space is full of terrors, with proper preparation and coordination any rando' can make good profit for the station.
## Preparations
Before leaving the station, ensure you are prepared with all the required equipment. The bare minimum is a [italic]EVA suit, a Jetpack, and a Mass Scanner.[/italic]
## Debris and You
The space surrounding the station is filled with debris from... somewhere. If you are salvaging, this is where you want to go. You will likely find scrap on these debris, which can be brought back to the station and either put in a recycler for materials or sold directly for profit, although most are worthless until refined.
## Survival
Salvaging is, suprisingly, pretty dangerous. The void is filled with fauna that are more then happy to kill you.
Even if you kill the fauna, there may be landmines or radioactive material lying around!
It's highly recommended you bring some weapons along with you. This can either be whatever you sticked together in Maintenance, or proper gear.
## Selective Salvaging
When you want something specific, or you looted everything in the local radius, you can use the [color=cyan]Salvage Magnet[/color] to pull in wrecks from... uh... somewhere. Once pulled in, it will show up not too far from the main station, and can be salvaged like normal debris, but will vanish in 6 minutes. Don't worry, you'll be warned before it does. Probably.
## Dead Space
As an [textlink="Antagonist" link="Antagonists"], Salvaging, and space in general, can prove to be very useful, depending on what you're looking for. The void is a great place for hiding from Security, and hiding your gear... or bodies.
Space can also provide useful resources, such as materials, radioactive objects, or basic weapons.
